title: The rise of Curt Cignetti, the fall of James Franklin and other midseason thoughts
content: Bill Connelly looks at both ends of the coaching world, plus the top players, the Heisman race and more.

title: Purdue tops preseason AP Top 25 poll for 1st time
content: Purdue is No. 1 in the preseason Associated Press Top 25 college basketball poll for the first time. The Boilermakers earned 35 of 61 first-place votes to top Monday's poll to begin the 2025-26 season.

title: Padres' Shildt retires, cites 'severe toll' of job
content: Mike Shildt is retiring as Padres manager with two years remaining on his contract, citing a "severe toll" the job has taken on him "mentally and physically."

title: Sources: Richardson likely out multiple games
content: Colts QB Anthony Richardson Sr. is likely to miss multiple games after suffering an orbital fracture in a freak pregame incident Sunday, sources told ESPN.

title: Postgame fight mars Chiefs' win against Lions
content: A long, frustrating night for the Lions ended with safety Brian Branch delivering an open-handed strike to Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster, setting off a brief fight among players from both teams.

title: Rams say Nacua (ankle) dodged long-term injury
content: Rams receiver Puka Nacua will be "day-to-day" with a sprained ankle, which he sustained in the second quarter of Sunday's win over the Baltimore Ravens. The team believes Nacua avoided long-term injury, based on the scans of his ankle.

title: A day later, Glenn admits Fields took 'step back'
content: Jets coach Aaron Glenn said Monday that Justin Fields "took a step back" with his performance against the Broncos, a day after he bristled at a question on his quarterback's play in the 13-11 loss.

title: Gamecocks F Kitts to miss season with ACL tear
content: Chloe Kitts, South Carolina's starting forward, will miss the 2025-26 season after tearing an ACL in her right knee, the Gamecocks announced on Monday. The 6-foot-2 senior will undergo surgery this week.

title: üèÄ NBA big-three tiers: Ranking teams' core trios
content: Who has the top core trio in the NBA? Which teams' big threes are on the rise, and which need work? ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks it down in 10 tiers.

title: Barnwell on the NFL's hottest seats: Three coaches and four players who could be in trouble after Week 6
content: Should the Dolphins, Titans or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: Questions, takeaways: Mahomes' TDs lead Chiefs; Panthers, Chargers win thrillers
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: Jayden Daniels and the QB battle that unlocked his greatness
content: Daniels was third on the depth chart when he transferred to LSU. This is how he won the QB battle and unlocked his potential.

title: Inside Caleb Williams vs. Jayden Daniels 2.0: A year after the Hail Mary
content: Daniels' numbers aren't as good as last year's while Williams' accuracy remains an issue; can either find a fix Monday?

title: Why Dodgers-Brewers NLCS could define MLB's labor battle
content: The big-money Dodgers and small-market Brewers exemplify two sides of the MLB payroll divide -- a fact no one will forget next spring.

title: Men's AP preseason Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: Here's what to know about each team in the AP men's preseason Top 25, from No. 1 Purdue to No. 25 North Carolina.

title: Why the Falcons are confident Michael Penix Jr. is ready for his MNF debut
content: Penix is coming off his best game as the second-year QB rewards Atlanta's faith in taking him in the first round.

title: Penn State fires James Franklin: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
content: After two shocking losses, Penn State is looking for a new coach. The job quickly becomes the best in this cycle.

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Everything to know with deadline looming
content: The CBA expires Oct. 31. Here are the biggest issues and how WNBA players' criticisms of Cathy Engelbert might impact negotiations.

title: Buzz from Sunday: Nacua, Egbuka injuries and a peak at Moody's game notes
content: Stephania Bell takes a closer look at the injuries from Sunday; Eric Moody shares his most interesting notes

title: Winners and losers: Dowdle makes case to keep starting; time to sack Fields?
content: Rico Dowdle, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and De'Von Achane dazzled, but several most reliable stars had a down week.

title: NFL Week 7 betting lines: Bucs-Lions and Commanders-Cowboys have highest totals
content: Two games have total points projections north of 50, and the Chiefs are double-digit favorites over the Raiders.

title: How USMNT, USWNT choose opponents, venues and prices for games
content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

title: Who is going to the World Series? Expert predictions for ALCS, NLCS
content: The Dodgers, Brewers, Blue Jays and Mariners remain. Here's who we think will move on -- and how our playoff predictions have fared so far.

title: Jaguars WR Travis Hunter takes part in life-changing event before Seahawks matchup
content: The Jacksonville Jaguars' two-way rookie took part in the life-changing decision at Celebration Church.

title: Premier League big issues: Will Amorim, Ange last? Is Salah a fading force?
content: The Premier League returns this weekend. With four matchdays until the next international break, what are the big issues looming over the next month?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Etta Eyong as Lewandowski replacement
content: Levante's Karl Etta Eyong has been identified as Robert Lewandowski's successor at Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar election 2025: Mahagatbandhan fails to arrive at seat-sharing formula acceptable to all allies
content: RJD‚Äôs chief holds two rounds of meeting with Congress leadership in Delhi but fails to break the deadlock; Congress insisting on 70 seats that it fought in 2020; RJD argues that with more constituents in grand alliance

title: Bhutan should compensate for North Bengal floods, says Mamata
content: West Bengal Chief Minister reiterates demand for setting up Indo-Bhutan¬†Joint River Commission, says State officials will attend meeting scheduled on October 16

title: 2023 saw decline in registered births and increase in registered deaths, says govt. report
content: There were 2.52 crore births in 2023, around 2.32 lakh fewer than in 2022. The Vital Statistics of India based on Civil Registration System (CRS) report for the year 2023 shows 86.6 lakh deaths were registered in 2023, a marginal increase from 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022.

title: Supreme Court refuses to quash FIR against folk singer for posts on PM
content: The court said it was not inclined to interfere at this stage but clarified that the singer could raise her objections when charges are framed before the trial court

title: Kashmir‚Äôs Baramulla district bans use of drones after Army raises alarm¬†
content: The Army has expressed fears following intelligence inputs that there was a possibility that drones would be smuggled into the Kashmir Valley

title: With women‚Äôs votes proving decisive, NDA goes all out to garner support
content: The lessons of the previous Assembly election and the 2024 Lok Sabha polls are very much on the minds of poll strategists in the ruling alliance; with women considered a particularly ‚Äòcasteless‚Äô voting bloc, it is little wonder that the NDA govt. in the State has rolled out schemes targeted at them

title: Idol Wing steps up efforts to recover three idols from U.K., Netherlands, and Singapore
content: The Idol Wing has been corresponding with foreign museums, the Union Ministry of Culture, and the respective foreign offices to recover the idols of Thirumangai Alwar, Kannappa Nayanar, and Hanuman

title: Bihar Court issues summonses to Rahul, Tejashwi over hurling of 'abuse' at PM Modi
content: The CJM has ordered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi Yadav, and Mukesh Sahani of the Vikassheel Insaan Party to appear before the court in person or through their legal representatives on November 26

title: Haryana IPS officer‚Äôs autopsy stalled for seven days, family wants DGP, ex-SP arrested
content: The SIT probing the case has sent a letter to the deceased officer‚Äôs wife, requesting her ‚Äúto come forward for identification of the body for the conduct of the PME (postmortem) at the earliest‚Äù

title: CM rejects media reports of ED summoning his son in 2023 on suspicion of money laundering
content: Pinarayi says adverse newspaper headlines and accusatory news chyrons on television channels will not deter him from taking the derogatory allegations aimed at causing him political and reputational damage head-on

title: B-SMILE drafts DPRs for 13 elevated corridors in Bengaluru worth ‚Çπ18,000 cr.
content: The initial proposal, submitted to the government in 2024, included building elevated corridors covering 110 km, estimated to cost around ‚Çπ13,200 crore, excluding land acquisition

title: Committee to modernise country‚Äôs first Cinematography and Sound Recording and Engineering Polytechnic College
content: The course in Cinematography and Sound Recording & Engineering was originally introduced in 1943 at Sri Jayachamarajendra Government Polytechnic as a result of the foresight of M.Visvesvaraya. In 1996, this course was renamed and relocated to Hesaraghatta, where it was spread across 25 acres, as the Government Film and Television Institute with assistance from the World Bank.

title: Citizen response programme will give Kerala a new sense of direction, says Pinarayi
content: Under the programme, scheduled from January 1 to February 28, 2026, volunteers will reach out to people, listen to their opinions and suggestions and prepare reports which will form the blueprint of Kerala‚Äôs path to progress

title: Actor-playwright Raju Talikoti passes away
content: He suffered a heart attack on Sunday night and passed away at KMC Hospital in Manipal of Udupi district on Monday evening

title: BJP targets RJD chief Lalu Prasad, his family over charges framed in IRCTC scam case
content: At a press conference, senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad urges the people of Bihar ‚Äònever to be taken in by Tejashwi Yadav‚Äôs promises, because jobs will not be provided and your land will be taken‚Äô

title: Onion glut triggers price crash in Dindigul wholesale market
content: About 10 days ago, the market at Dindigul received 250 tonnes of onion and the price was fixed at ‚Çπ25 a kg. On Monday, a fresh stock of 300 tonnes arrived triggering a crash in price

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis confirmed in two children in Kerala
content: Health officials confirmed that 40 persons are undergoing treatment for amoebic meningoencephalitis in public and private hospitals across the State

title: Minibus hits culvert near Ongole, one dead
content: The police officials rescued 19 occupants of the minibus which  hit a culvert, overturned and fell into a canal

title: Sharjeel Imam seeks two-week bail to contest Bihar election
content: Lodged in Tihar jail for over five years and awaiting trial in a larger conspiracy case related to north-east Delhi Riots 2020, Imam seeks to contest as an Independent candidate from Bahadurganj constituency in his home State.

title: Kandukur farmers cry foul over compensation in NH 167B land acquisition
content: Nearly 30 farmers from Kanumalla, Palukuru and Oguru panchayats write letters to Chief Minister, Deputy CM, IT and R&B ministers demanding compensation as per the existing market value of the land

title: Post seat-sharing, JD(U) no longer senior partner in NDA in Bihar
content: With the JD(U) and the BJP contesting on 101 seats each, the dominance of Nitish Kumar‚Äôs party in the alliance is on the wane; though Mr. Kumar still remains at the helm of the NDA in Bihar, concerns about his health and age bother voters, some on whom want the leader to make way for someone younger

title: Tejashwi Yadav cries political vendetta after charges framed against him and his family in IRCTC scam case
content: Framing it as a battle between Biharis and ‚Äònon-Biharis‚Äô, the RJD leader says he will continue to fight the BJP in the political arena

title: Over 3 lakh schools register for Viksit Bharat Buildathon
content: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan hopes the effort will lead to creation of ‚Äòglobal models and solutions for pressing domestic and global challenges‚Äô

title: YSRCP seeks NHRC probe into tribal students‚Äô deaths in Parvathipuram district
content: Accuse the TDP-NDA alliance government of gross negligence and urge the NHRC to ensure accountability for what they called a ‚Äúhumanitarian tragedy‚Äù

title: Kalaburagi bandh evokes good response¬†
content: The call was given by¬†Kalyana Karnataka Raitha Horata Samiti demanding that the Central and State governments¬†release flood compensation

title: Job aspirants in Mysuru seek fill up of vacant govt. posts
content: The committee claims that thousands of posts are lying vacant across 43 government departments in the State as of the year 2025-26

title: Spurious liquor racket has links to Goa, Bengaluru and Mumbai, say Excise officials
content: The accused were allegedly manufacturing Non-Duty Paid Liquor and marketing it through various liquor outlets in Mulakalacheru and the ANR Restaurant and Bar owned by them

title: State to take steps to extend SC relief to other aided managements
content: Will make position known on aided school appointments to SC when case is taken up on October 16, says Minister

title: Uttarakhand eases marriage registration rules under UCC for people of Nepal, Bhutan and Tibet
content: A govt. official says the aim of the amendment in the Uniform Civil Code is aimed at giving respite to the people of Nepal, Bhutan, and Tibet, which not just share an international border with Uttarakhand but also have historic and cultural ties with the State in the form of residence, relationships, and marriage

title: Release compensation immediately for crop loss, CM told
content: The former MLA Narasimha Naik (Rajugouda) has said that Yadgir district has suffered huge loss due to copious rainfall and also floods

title: Non-Veg Party At Surat School Sparks Row, Principal Suspended
content: A non-vegetarian party in the premises of a government-run school in Surat city of Gujarat has created a huge controversy and led to the suspension of the principal.

title: Hamas Urges Trump To Ensure Israel Does Not Resume 'Aggression' Against Gaza
content: Hamas on Monday urged US President Donald Trump and the mediators of the Gaza ceasefire deal to ensure that Israel does not resume military operations in the territory.

title: Netanyahu Says He Won't Be Able to Attend Gaza Summit In Egypt
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will not attend Monday's Gaza summit in the Egyptian resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh because it coincides with a Jewish holiday, his office said.

title: Truck Driver Flees After Running Over 11-Year-Old Boy In Delhi: Cops
content: An 11-year-old boy was killed after being hit by a dumper truck in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar area, police said on Monday.

title: "I'm All About Stopping War": Trump In Israel Amid Cheers, Call for Nobel
content: US President Donald Trump praised Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as he began his speech in the Israeli Parliament hours after Hamas freed 20 remaining hostages:"Thank you very much, Bibi. Great job".

title: PM Modi Welcomes Release Of All Hamas Hostages, Backs Trump's Peace Efforts
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday welcomed the release of Israeli hostages while hailing the "unwavering peace efforts" of US President Donald Trump and the "strong resolve" Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Over 75% Women In Bangladesh Experience Violence After Marriage: Survey
content: More than 75 percent of married Bangladeshi women experience violence from partners at least once in their lifetime, a national survey published Monday said.

title: Trump Goes Off-Script At Israel Parliament, Urges Pardon For Netanyahu Over "Cigars, Champagne"
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday told the Israeli parliament that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases, should be pardoned.

title: Prashant Kishor's Party Releases 2nd List Of 65 Names For Bihar Polls
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party has released its second list of 65 candidates for the coming Bihar assembly elections, holding fast to its core promise of inclusiveness and representation to every section.

title: Licence Of Tamil Nadu Firm Behind 'Killer' Cough Syrup Revoked
content: The Tamil Nadu Drug Control department has revoked the complete licence of Sresan Pharma, which manufactured 'Coldrif' cough syrup that led to the deaths of several children across India.

title: "Is Having A Meal A Major Crime?" Siddaramaiah On Row Over Dinner Meet
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah while responding to rumours surrounding the dinner meet hosted by him for his Cabinet Ministers in Bengaluru, asked on Monday that "having a meal with Cabinet Ministers is supposed to be a major crime".

title: India's $77 Billion Hydro Plan As China Builds Upstream Dam
content: India's power planning authority has drawn up a Rs 6.4 trillion ($77 billion) transmission plan to move more than 76 gigawatts of hydroelectric capacity from the Brahmaputra basin by 2047 to meet rising electricity demand.

title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Standing Ovation For Trump At Israeli Parliament
content: Israel Gaza Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Israeli¬†Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife Sara, along with President Isaac Herzog and his wife Michal, welcomed US President Donald Trump upon his arrival at Ben-Gurion International Airport.

title: 'Trump, Teleprompters Working Beautifully': Israel Mocks Malfunction At UN
content: US President Donald Trump arrived in Israel on Monday as Hamas handed over the 20 surviving Israeli hostages under a breakthrough ceasefire agreement.

title: Afghanistan-Pakistan Is The Latest Conflict Trump Wants To Solve. Why Has It Erupted?
content: Border clashes over the weekend between Afghanistan and Pakistan led to the deaths of dozens of soldiers, the most serious clash between the two countries since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in 2021, and gained the attention of Trump.

title: "Incident Shook The Nation": Supreme Court Orders CBI Probe In Karur Stampede
content: A three-member committee headed by a retired Supreme Court judge will oversee the probe into the stampede during TVK chief Vijay's rally last month.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump's Gaza Plan: Ushering "Peace for Our Time" In West Asia?
content: The long-elusive ceasefire is only the opening overture of a fiendishly complicated serial act. Seasoned observers of the region advise taking it with a ladleful of salt.

title: Upset Over Rajya Sabha Seats, J&K Congress Wants To End Alliance
content: The alliance between the Congress and the National Conference in Jammu and Kashmir is on the rocks following the rift between the two over Rajya Sabha seats.

title: "World Needs More Trumps": Israel's Standing Ovation For US President
content: US President Donald Trump received a standing ovation from Israeli lawmakers ahead of his speech to parliament, as Hamas released 20 living hostages as part of a breakthrough Gaza ceasefire deal.

title: WWE Crown Jewel takeaways: Cena, Styles pass the torch to Rollins, Rhodes
content: the match between two retiring legends at the end of this year and Styles in 2026 featured an impressive amount of tributes to past opponents and WWE legends . only The Undertaker has more with 107, a record we will have to wait a while to see broken .

title: One thing you shouldn't be surprised by ... for every NBA team
content: if he gets hurt again, we must reevaluate. PF/SF Jayson Tatum is out for much of the season . SG/PG Derrick White will see a career-best in shots .

title: 'Dawn of new Middle East': Trump paints rosy picture after Gaza deal ‚Äî too soon to cheer?
content: US President Donald Trump declared a "long and painful nightmare" over for Israel, announcing a Gaza ceasefire and Hamas disarmament. He hailed the unprecedented regional endorsement of the plan, marking a "historic dawn of a new Middle East." Trump also praised Prime Minister Netanyahu, calling for his pardon amid legal challenges and celebrating the return of Israeli hostages.

title: Arson, clashes, chaos: Pak gripped by violence as TLP protest turns ugly ‚Äî key points
content: Pakistan grapples with escalating unrest following a significant crackdown on the Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP). Authorities detained hundreds and sealed routes to halt a planned march to Islamabad, with the TLP accusing police of using lethal force. The group, protesting in solidarity with Palestine and against recognizing Israel, reported numerous casualties and injuries amid violent clashes.

title: Unexpected drama! Girl slaps boy in stands during IND vs WI Test
content: During the India vs. West Indies Test, an unusual off-field incident saw a girl physically confront a boy in the stands, captured by broadcast cameras and quickly going viral. While the match saw India in a strong position to win, the fan altercation dominated online discussions about crowd behavior.

title: Apple CEO may retire soon; Former CEO hints, calls for AI-era leader
content: Former Apple CEO John Sculley suggests Tim Cook might retire soon, emphasizing the need for a successor to guide Apple into the 'agentic era' beyond apps. Sculley also identified OpenAI as Apple's first significant competitor in years, highlighting a shift towards subscription models and smart agents over numerous applications.

title: 'Leave GT, join CSK': Fan's message to Sai Sudharsan after viral burger clip - Watch
content: Sai Sudharsan, the Gujarat Titans' Orange Cap winner, is generating significant buzz ahead of the IPL 2026 auction. A viral fan video from a recent Test match fueled speculation about a potential move to Chennai Super Kings, his hometown team. His consistent performances and Tamil Nadu roots make him a prime target for CSK.

title: EPFO allows up to 100% part PF withdrawal: Digital services simplified
content: EPFO has significantly liberalized partial withdrawal rules, allowing subscribers up to 100% of their EPF balance for essential needs, housing, and special circumstances. Minimum service for withdrawals is now 12 months. The organization also introduced a scheme to reduce litigation and a digital transformation plan for faster, automated services, enhancing ease of living for millions.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor‚Äôs WhatsApp plea; suggests Zoho‚Äôs Arattai
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. A doctor's petition seeking restoration of her blocked account was dismissed, with the court suggesting alternative apps like Zoho's Arattai. The ruling emphasizes that users must adhere to platform policies for privately operated services.

title: 'Welcome release of all hostages': PM Modi pledges support for Trump's Gaza plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the Gaza peace deal and the release of hostages held for over two years. He lauded the families' courage and the peace efforts of President Trump and Prime Minister Netanyahu. This development follows a devastating conflict initiated by Hamas attacks on October 7, 2023, and Israel's subsequent military response.

title: When was the last time a Test in India went into Day 5?
content: India stands on the brink of a series whitewash against West Indies, needing just 58 runs to win the second Test. Despite a strong fightback from the visitors, highlighted by centuries from Shai Hope and John Campbell, India's bowlers, led by Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, eventually gained control.  KL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan are set to finish the job.

title: Cars to fighter planes: Xi's shock & awe gambit - will Trump blink first?
content: China has imposed sweeping export controls on critical materials like rare earths and electric motors, impacting global supply chains from cars to defense systems. This move escalates the trade conflict, prompting US President Trump to threaten further tariffs and export restrictions. The situation highlights a new phase of economic confrontation with significant implications for international trade and security.

title: Tech crash: Trump‚Äôs China tariffs causes $770 bn wipeout from Amazon, Nvidia, Tesla
content: Tech giants like Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla faced a massive $770 billion market value drop following President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on China and export controls.  This significant market downturn, the worst since April, also impacted the Nasdaq and S&P 500, with Bitcoin experiencing a sharp decline as well.

title: Pakistan Hockey warns before India clash - 'If India don't shake hands '
content: Pakistan's hockey federation has cautioned its junior team against engaging with Indian players during their Sultan of Johor Cup match. Following a similar incident in cricket, Pakistani players are instructed to ignore potential non-handshakes and avoid any on-field altercations. The federation stresses maintaining focus on the game amidst these diplomatic tensions.

title: Chloe Kitts injury: South Carolina star out for 2025-26 after medical emergency
content: South Carolina's Chloe Kitts will miss the entire 2025-26 season after tearing her ACL. The senior, an honorable mention All-American and MVP of the NCAA Birmingham 2 Regional and SEC Tournament, will undergo surgery this week. Coach Dawn Staley expressed disappointment but confidence in her team's ability to step up.

title: Kannada actor-comedian Raju Talikote passes away due to cardiac arrest - Report
content: Legendary actor and comedian Raju Talikote breathed his last at Manipal Hospital in Udupi, succumbing to complications from age and a heart attack. Renowned for his memorable performances as a comedic drunkard, Talikote had just wrapped filming on a new project. His family has announced that his farewell ceremonies will take place in Vijayapura.

title: Top 5 sectors reshaping jobs in 2025: Tech and green skills surge; new roles emerge
content: The India Skills Report 2025 reveals the top five sectors reshaping workforce needs globally, highlighting growing demand for digital skills and renewable energy roles. Technology, healthcare, fintech, renewable energy, and e-commerce are driving job growth across key regions. The report emphasises the importance of upskilling and formal employment to meet evolving talent demands, positioning India as a major player in the global workforce transformation by 2025.

title: Mohammed Siraj collapses after long spell, receives 'king-like' treatment - See pic
content: Delhi's intense heat overwhelmed Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj, causing him to collapse from exhaustion during the second Test against the West Indies. After a demanding spell, he received immediate medical attention.  Despite the challenging conditions and the West Indies' strong batting performance, India is poised for a series victory.

title: 'Greatest friend of Israel': Bibi praises Trump; thanks him for 5 key decisions
content: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu nominates US President Donald Trump for the Israel Prize, Israel's highest honour

title: 4 everyday drinks to prevent artery plaque buildup and boost blood circulation
content: Nourishing your arteries involves mindful eating and drinking. Certain beverages like green tea, pomegranate juice, beetroot juice, and turmeric milk can significantly support heart health by reducing inflammation, lowering bad cholesterol, and promoting healthy blood flow. While plaque buildup cannot be reversed, these drinks can help stabilize and potentially shrink it.

title: Taylor Swift: Emotional eras tour docuseries packed with Travis Kelce moments
content: Taylor Swift is releasing a six-episode Disney+ docuseries, 'The End of an Era,' on December 12th. It offers an intimate look at her record-breaking Eras Tour and her relationship with NFL star Travis Kelce. The series promises behind-the-scenes footage, emotional moments, and candid glimpses of their private life, including Kelce's surprise onstage cameo.

title: Jimmy Shergill‚Äôs father, Satyajit Singh Shergill passes away at 90; Antim Ardas on October 14
content: Bollywood actor Jimmy Shergill has experienced a significant personal loss with the passing of his father, Satyajit Singh Shergill, at the age of 90. Satyajit Singh, a senior artist himself, hailed from a family with a rich artistic legacy, including a connection to painter Amrita Sher-Gil. The Antim Ardas will be held on October 14 in Mumbai.

title: Hamas releases hostages: Fate of Bipin Joshi unclear; kin await good news
content: Two hostages, Bipin Joshi and Tamir Nimrodi, remain unaccounted for after Hamas's latest release of 20 living captives. While 20 living hostages and 28 bodies are part of the deal, the fate of these two is unknown. Joshi, a Nepalese student, was abducted during the October 7th attack. His family recently released footage, hoping for his return.

title: Pakistan's oldest living cricket player passes away at 95 in Birmingham
content: Pakistan's oldest cricketer, Wazir Mohammad, has passed away at 95 in the UK. A key member of Pakistan's inaugural Test squad in 1952, he represented the nation in 20 matches between 1952 and 1959. Mohammad was celebrated for his graceful batting, notably a stellar 189 against the West Indies and a vital 42 in the historic 1954 Oval Test win.

title: Josh Allen admits crying watching Hailee Steinfeld‚Äôs scenes with Michael B Jordan
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen shared his deep admiration for his wife Hailee Steinfeld's acting in her new film 'Sinners'. Allen admitted to becoming emotional watching Steinfeld's performance, highlighting his pride in her talent. The couple, married in May 2025, skillfully balance their demanding careers. Steinfeld often adjusts her schedule to support Allen's NFL season, demonstrating their mutual dedication.

title: PCB chief Naqvi asks ICC to ready backup plan amid Tri-series uncertainty
content: Pakistan Cricket Board is developing backup plans for a T20 Tri-Series involving Sri Lanka, as Afghanistan's participation remains uncertain due to bilateral tensions. The series, slated for November, faces potential scheduling conflicts with a proposed series against Sri Lanka in January, impacting Pakistani players' availability for the Big Bash League and potentially causing friction with Cricket Australia.

title: Massive prediction! 'Virat Kohli will score two centuries vs Australia'
content: Legendary spinner Harbhajan Singh expressed confidence in Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's prolific run-scoring in the upcoming ODI series against Australia. Singh highlighted Kohli's exceptional fitness and predicted he would score at least two centuries in Australia, his favored batting ground. He anticipates both stalwarts will perform exceptionally well, contributing significantly to India's victories.

title: Bhopal: After fight over ‚Äòchange‚Äô, delivery boy returns with 8, thrashes 2
content: A dispute over change for a Rs 474 delivery escalated into violence in Bhopal's Kolar area. A quick commerce company's delivery boy returned with several colleagues, armed with sticks, and assaulted two helpers of a businessman. The group caused a significant disturbance for over half an hour before fleeing. A video of the incident has since gone viral.

title: Nobel prize in Economics: Trio get award for work on threats to 'economic stagnation'
content: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences honored Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion, and Peter Howitt with the 2025 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences. Their groundbreaking work explains how innovation drives sustained economic growth, a phenomenon that has lifted millions out of poverty. This recognition highlights their significant contributions to understanding long-term prosperity through technological progress and creative destruction.

title: IND vs WI: Siraj warns Justin Greaves against scoring more; decision backfires
content: During the second Test against West Indies, Mohammed Siraj showcased a playful side, jokingly warning Justin Greaves. Despite the banter, Greaves scored a half-century as the West Indies tail added crucial runs. Siraj also became the leading Test wicket-taker in 2025, dismissing Shai Hope for his 37th wicket of the year.

title: ‚ÄòBiggest crash in history coming‚Äô: Rich Dad Poor Dad author's warning; recommends buying silver
content: Robert Kiyosaki warns of a global marker crash that will devastate Baby Boomer retirement savings, predicting a major crash this year. He advocates for tangible assets like silver and Ethereum over paper investments, emphasizing their industrial utility and potential for significant growth.

title: Durgapur to RG Kar: Are Bengal‚Äôs campuses safe? CM‚Äôs ‚Äòstay inside‚Äô stance questioned
content: Despite Kolkata's reputation as India's safest city, female students in West Bengal face a growing crisis of insecurity. Recent brutal assaults, like the Durgapur gang rape, highlight persistent gaps in campus security and institutional accountability. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's advice for women to stay indoors has drawn widespread condemnation, reinforcing a culture of victim-blaming rather than addressing systemic failures.

title: MBBS student rape case: BJP hits out at Mamata over ‚Äò12:30 am‚Äô remark
content: The BJP has criticised West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee for her remarks on a recent gangrape incident, accusing her of justifying rape and victim-blaming.  Mamata suggested women should not go out late at night, a statement BJP leaders argue shifts responsibility from perpetrators to victims and highlights a regressive mindset.

title: Watch: Trump gets 'thank you' note at Tel Aviv beachfront; Air Force One flies over it
content: US President Donald Trump arrived in Israel, greeted by a large "Thank You" banner along the Tel Aviv coastline. During his four-hour visit, he met with hostage families, held talks with Prime Minister Netanyahu, and addressed lawmakers. The visit coincides with the second anniversary of the October 7th attacks and the return of some hostages.

title: Abel Ariza‚Äôs journey from bellboy to CEO fueled by a ‚Ç¨300 tip from DiCaprio
content: Everhaus Group CEO Abel Ariza's leadership journey began as a bellboy at the Ritz-Carlton Barcelona. Encounters with figures like Leonardo DiCaprio, Bill Clinton, and Nelson Mandela instilled values of discipline, humility, and valuing people. Ariza now applies these formative lessons to foster purpose-driven leadership and a culture of trust at Everhaus Group.

title: Before fame: Travis Kelce nearly quit football before NFL stardom
content: Travis Kelce faced a college suspension for a failed drug test. His brother Jason Kelce helped him get a second chance. Kelce then switched to tight end and excelled. He overcame personal struggles and family health worries. Now a Super Bowl champion, he is also engaged to Taylor Swift. Kelce's story shows how determination can lead to success.

title: Historic first! Tata Trusts approves N Chandrasekaran‚Äôs third five-year executive term
content: Tata Trusts has approved a third executive term for N Chandrasekaran as Tata Sons chairman, a move unprecedented due to the group's retirement policy. This decision aims to ensure continuity for critical projects like semiconductors and electric vehicle batteries amidst business transformation and internal discussions about the group's private status.

title: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô mom shares heartfelt post after Chiefs beat Lions
content: Patrick Mahomes led the Kansas City Chiefs to a 30-17 victory over the Detroit Lions. Off the field, his mother Randi Mahomes shared a heartwarming moment with Brittany Mahomes and granddaughter Mia, highlighting the family's strong support. Brittany also showcased her game-day style and dedication from the sidelines.

title: 'Lalu known as management guru': Tejashwi reacts after charges framed in IRCTC case
content: A Delhi court ordered charges to be framed against RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, his mother Rabri Devi, and father Lalu Prasad Yadav in the IRCTC scam. Tejashwi Yadav decried the move as political vendetta ahead of Bihar polls, vowing to fight the case. The charges stem from alleged irregularities in leasing railway hotels.

title: Trump's 100% tariff row: China urges US to correct ‚Äòwrong practices‚Äô
content: Beijing has warned of "corresponding measures" against US tariffs on Chinese goods, urging Washington to correct "wrong practices." This response follows President Trump's plan for an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

title: Indian woman narrowly escapes chain snatching in Chicago - video
content: An Indian woman, Chabi Gupta, narrowly escaped a chain snatching attempt in downtown Chicago, sustaining bruises but saving her locket. She shared her harrowing experience on Instagram, highlighting a recent rise in street robberies in the city and urging others to stay vigilant and protect their valuables.

title: An NBA dynasty reborn? Why the Warriors could be more dangerous than you think
content: the Golden State Warriors have just the seventh-best odds to win the West this season . they are behind the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder, Denver Nuggets, Houston Rockets , los Angeles Lakers , Minnesota Timberwolves and LA Clippers . if Buddy Hield joins Stephen Curry , Jimmy Butler III , Draymond Green and Al Horford in the starting lineup .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: Bucks unite Antetokounmpos, sign younger bro
content: the Milwaukee Bucks are waiving guard Jamaree Bouyea from a two-way contract to create roster space for Alex . it marks the first time in NBA history that three brothers are signed on active roster contracts with the same team .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: College football: Who are the top title contenders? Look to the trenches
content: the best teams in the country aren't quarterback-driven, they are line-driven . the top teams are Ohio State , Indiana , Texas Tech , Miami and Texas A&M . five of those six are undefeated .

title: AP Week 7 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the top two teams in the poll stayed steady but there was movement not far below . then-no. 7 Indiana went to then no. 3 Oregon and notched a big win to declare themselves as legitimate national title contenders . Alabama and Ole Miss squeaked out wins . now they are atop the SEC alongside Texas A&M .

title: Power Rankings: Indiana climbs into top 3; four new teams join the Top 25
content: Oklahoma can still make the playoffs even with a loss to Texas . Ohio State allowed a whopping 16 points at Illinois, seven more than it had in any other game this season . the most dominant team is looking for areas to improve as the midpoint of 2025 season arrives .
